New Records: The Dallas Mavericks defeated the Orlando Magic with a final score of 108-85.
Luka Doncic scored 32 points for the Mavericks.
Dereck Lively II had 18 points and 11 rebounds, while Daniel Gafford contributed with 8 rebounds and 71% field goal percentage.
Key Match Events: The Mavericks outscored the Magic 46-20 in the second half, securing a significant lead.
The Magic struggled without star forward Paolo Banchero, particularly in the paint and on the rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: The Magic were without Paolo Banchero, who had been averaging 29 points per game this season.
The Magic ranked 25th in scoring, and their offensive struggles were evident without Banchero.
Post-Match Reflections: Magic coach Jamahl Mosley expressed frustration over Banchero's injury and the team's offensive struggles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Magic only spent a few minutes in the American Airlines Center before departing for their next game.
The Magic finished the game with a 19.5% three-point shooting percentage, their worst rate of the season.
